required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ICP-192 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center Open-label, Phase I/II Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of ICP-192 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors and FGFR Gene Alterations

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing InnoCare Pharma Tech Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Beijing InnoCare Pharma Tech Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, open-label, phase I/II clinical study to evaluate ICP-192 in patients with advanced solid tumors and FGFR gene alterations. It consists of two parts: Part I (Phase I), dose escalation and Part II (Phase II), dose expansion.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.description: Phase I: Dose Escalation & Phase II: Dose Expansion To evaluate the safety and tolerability of different doses of ICP-192 in patients with advanced solid tumors
Phase I: Dose Escalation To determine Maximum Tolerated Dose（MTD) for ICP-192
Phase I: Dose Escalation To determine Optimal Biological Dose (OBD) for ICP-192
Phase I: Dose Escalation To determine Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D) for ICP-192
Phase II: Dose Expansion Objective Response Rate

secondary_outcome.description: Phase I: Dose Escalation Peak concentration (Cmax)
Phase II: Dose Expansion disease control rate
Phase II: Dose Expansion duration of response
Phase II: Dose Expansion progression-free survival
Phase II: Dose Expansion overall survival

other_outcome.description: Phase II: Dose Expansion Assessment of the correlations between drug exposure (e.g., AUC, Cmax) and patient response to ICP-192.
Phase II: Dose Expansion Assessment of the correlations between PD biomarker and patient response to ICP-192.

arm_group.description: Dose Escalation Phase ICP-192 Dose Expansion Phase ICP-192

intervention.description: Dose Escalation Phase ICP-192 will be taken by patients with advanced solid tumor and will be treated follow the "3+3" dose escalation scheme Dose Expansion Phase ICP-192 will be taken by patients with urothelial carcinoma or cholangiocarcinoma with FGFR gene alterations and will be treated at a single dose defined from the Dose Escalation Phase.
